phases.name: Backend Foundation — Models, DB, Repo & Service
phases.purpose: Establish the Python package structure, database connection pool, Timer model, repository, and core TimerService business logic (create, start, stop, reset, urgency computation).

file_manifest.description: Pin all backend dependencies: fastapi, uvicorn, asyncpg, pydantic, pytest, httpx, python-dotenv.
Example environment variables file with DATABASE_URL and CORS_ORIGINS placeholders.
Python package marker for app.
Reads DATABASE_URL and CORS_ORIGINS from environment variables.
Creates and exposes an asyncpg connection pool; provides get_pool() and close_pool() lifecycle helpers.
Package marker.

exports: class TimerStatus(str, Enum): idle, running, paused, complete
class Timer(BaseModel): id: UUID, duration: int, elapsed_time: int, status: TimerStatus, urgency_level: int, created_at: datetime, updated_at: datetime
class TimerResponse(BaseModel): id: UUID, duration: int, elapsed_time: int, status: TimerStatus, urgency_level: int, created_at: datetime, updated_at: datetime
class TimerListResponse(BaseModel): items: list[TimerResponse], count: int
file_manifest.description: Pydantic models for Timer entity and request/response schemas.
Package marker.

exports: async def TimerRepo.create(self, duration: int) -> Timer
async def TimerRepo.get_by_id(self, timer_id: UUID) -> Timer | None
async def TimerRepo.update(self, timer_id: UUID, elapsed_time: int, status: TimerStatus, urgency_level: int) -> Timer | None
file_manifest.description: asyncpg-backed repository for all CRUD operations on the timers table.
Package marker.

exports: async def TimerService.create_timer(self, duration: int) -> Timer
async def TimerService.start_timer(self, timer_id: UUID) -> Timer
async def TimerService.stop_timer(self, timer_id: UUID) -> Timer
async def TimerService.reset_timer(self, timer_id: UUID) -> Timer
async def TimerService.tick_timer(self, timer_id: UUID) -> Timer
def TimerService.compute_urgency(self, elapsed_time: int, duration: int) -> int
file_manifest.description: Orchestrates timer lifecycle: create, start, stop, reset; computes urgency_level from elapsed_time/duration ratio.

exports: CREATE TABLE timers (id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(), duration INTEGER NOT NULL, elapsed_time INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'idle', urgency_level INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now(), updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now())
file_manifest.description: SQL migration that creates the timers table with all canonical columns.
Package marker for tests.
Unit tests for TimerService urgency computation and state transitions using a mock repo.

acceptance_criteria.description: TimerService.compute_urgency returns 0 for 0–33% elapsed, 1 for 33–66%, 2 for 66–90%, 3 for 90%+.
TimerRepo.create inserts a row with status=idle and elapsed_time=0 and returns a Timer with a valid UUID.
Migration 001_create_timers.sql runs without error against a local PostgreSQL instance.
All unit tests pass: pytest -x tests/test_timer_service.py

phases.name: Backend API Layer — Routers, App Entry & Integration Tests
phases.purpose: Wire FastAPI routers for all timer endpoints and the health check, mount them on the app entry point with CORS, and add integration tests covering every route.

file_manifest.description: Package marker.
GET /health endpoint returning {status: ok}.
All timer REST endpoints: create, list, start, stop, reset.

exports: app: FastAPI (entry point for uvicorn app.main:app)
file_manifest.description: FastAPI application factory: registers startup/shutdown pool lifecycle, mounts health and timers routers, configures CORS.
Integration tests for all timer API endpoints using httpx AsyncClient against the FastAPI app with a test database.
pytest fixtures: async test client, test database pool, table teardown between tests.

acceptance_criteria.description: POST /api/v1/timers with {"duration": 60} returns HTTP 201 and a response body containing a valid UUID id.
uvicorn app.main:app --reload starts without import errors.

phases.name: Frontend — React + Vite Countdown UI with Character Animations
phases.purpose: Build the complete React + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS single-page app: API client, state hooks, CharacterFace pixel art, TimerDisplay, controls, urgency color logic, and real-time polling.

file_manifest.description: NPM manifest with React 18, Vite, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Vitest, and React Testing Library dependencies.
Vite config: React plugin, dev server proxy /api → localhost:8000.
Tailwind CSS config with content paths and retro color palette extensions.
TypeScript config for React + Vite project.
Vite HTML entry point mounting the React app root.
React app entry: renders <App /> into #root with StrictMode.
Root component: renders TimerContainer centered on a full-viewport dark background.

exports: interface Timer { id: string; duration: number; elapsedTime: number; status: TimerStatus; urgencyLevel: number; createdAt: string; updatedAt: string }
interface TimerListResponse { items: Timer[]; count: number }
file_manifest.description: TypeScript interfaces matching the backend Timer schema.
Thin fetch-based API client for all backend timer endpoints.

exports: function useTimer(initialDurationSeconds?: number): { timer: Timer | null; isLoading: boolean; error: string | null; createAndStart: (duration: number) => Promise<void>; start: () => Promise<void>; stop: () => Promise<void>; reset: () => Promise<void> }
file_manifest.description: Custom hook managing a single timer: polls backend every second when running, exposes start/stop/reset actions and current timer state.
Pure utility functions: compute urgency level, map urgency to Tailwind color class and CSS animation class.
Top-level layout wrapper: full viewport, centered column, dark background; composes all sub-components.

exports: interface CharacterFaceProps { urgencyLevel: number; status: TimerStatus }
file_manifest.description: Pixel-art Pac-Man-style SVG/CSS smiley face; renders happy, anxious, or upset expression based on urgencyLevel prop.
Large MM:SS countdown display with monospace font; applies urgency color class and flash animation.

exports: interface DurationInputProps { onSubmit: (seconds: number) => void; disabled: boolean }
file_manifest.description: Numeric input for setting duration in seconds; calls onSubmit with parsed value.

exports: interface ControlButtonsProps { status: TimerStatus | null; onStart: () => void; onStop: () => void; onReset: () => void; isLoading: boolean }
file_manifest.description: Start, Stop, and Reset buttons; shows/hides Stop vs Start based on timer status.
Tailwind CSS directives plus custom keyframe animations for urgency flash effect.

exports: test renders happy face for urgencyLevel 0
test renders anxious face for urgencyLevel 2
test renders upset face for urgencyLevel 3
file_manifest.description: Vitest + RTL tests: verifies happy/anxious/upset expressions render for urgencyLevel 0/2/3.

exports: test formatMMSS converts seconds to MM:SS
test getUrgencyColor returns correct Tailwind class per level
test shouldFlash returns true when elapsed >= 90% of duration
file_manifest.description: Vitest unit tests for formatMMSS, getUrgencyColor, and shouldFlash utility functions.

acceptance_criteria.test_hint: manual: cd web && npm run dev
acceptance_criteria.description: npm run dev starts the Vite dev server without errors and the Main Timer Screen loads at http://localhost:5173.
User can enter a duration in seconds, click Start, and see the MM:SS display decrement every second.
TimerDisplay color shifts to yellow when urgency_level >= 2 and to red with flash animation when urgency_level = 3.
CharacterFace renders the correct expression (happy/anxious/upset) for urgency levels 0, 2, 3.
Stop button pauses the countdown; Start resumes from the paused value.
Reset button returns elapsed_time to 0 and the character to the happy idle state.
npx vitest --run passes all frontend unit and component tests.

summary.one_liner: A retro 8-bit countdown timer with a FastAPI backend, PostgreSQL persistence, and a React + Vite frontend featuring Pac-Man-style character expressions and urgency color shifts.
key_constraints: MINI-BUILD: no authentication, no user management, no Docker files — all endpoints are public
Timers table is the only DB table; claimed in Phase 0
Layer boundaries enforced: routers → services → repos; no cross-layer imports
Timer status enum: idle | running | paused | complete
Urgency levels 0–3 computed from elapsed_time / duration ratio in TimerService
Color thresholds: green 0–33%, yellow 33–66%, red 66%+, flashing at 90%+
Schema has duplicate column definitions — canonical columns: id UUID PK, duration INT, elapsed_time INT, status VARCHAR, urgency_level INT, created_at TIMESTAMPTZ, updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ

Physics contract has duplicate path keys — canonical endpoints per blueprint: POST /api/v1/timers, GET /api/v1/timers, POST /api/v1/timers/{id}/start, POST /api/v1/timers/{id}/stop, POST /api/v1/timers/{id}/reset, GET /health
Frontend polls backend every second while timer is running
Frontend lives in /web directory; backend entry is app.main
summary.stack_rationale: FastAPI with asyncpg provides async-first PostgreSQL access with minimal boilerplate. React + Vite + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS delivers the pixel-art retro UI with real-time polling. PostgreSQL stores timer state durably and supports UUID primary keys natively.
missing_contracts: phases (not found — phasing derived from blueprint and manifesto)

contract_refs.note: Defines status enum (idle/running/paused/complete), urgency color thresholds (33/66/90%), and 1-second decrement rule
Endpoint contracts used to define router exports; duplicate path keys resolved in favour of blueprint canonical list
Duplicate column definitions resolved: canonical columns are id, duration, elapsed_time, status, urgency_level, created_at, updated_at
Enforces routers→services→repos import direction; no DB drivers in routers; services not HTTP-aware
DATABASE_URL and CORS_ORIGINS must be read from env; exposed via app/config.py
Component names (TimerDisplay, CharacterFace, DurationInput, ControlButtons, TimerContainer) and urgency color hex values used directly
Three flows (set+run, pause+resume, quick reset) map directly to AC-2-2 through AC-2-6
Confirms pixel-art Pac-Man character as central UI element with expression progression
